title: The South Centre | Benjamin William MKAPA (Chairman, 2006–2018)

quotes: Benjamin William MKAPA (Chairman, 2006–2018)
was the third President of the United-Republic of Tanzania (from November 1995 to December 2005)
was the third President of the United-Republic of Tanzania (from November 1995 to December 2005) since independence in 1961
Former President Mkapa was born in 1938 in Masasi, in the Mtwara region of the country
obtaining a Bachelor of Arts degree in English (with honours) in 1962
He was appointed District Officer in 1962
In 1966 Mr. Mkapa embarked upon a long career in journalism
In 1974, Mr. Mkapa became the Founding Editor of the Tanzania News Agency (SHIHATA)
He was High Commissioner to Nigeria in 1976
He was then appointed Minister for Foreign Affairs from 1977 to 1980
Minister for Information and Culture from 1980 to 1982
In 1982, he served as High Commissioner to Canada
between 1983 and 1984 as Ambassador of his country to the United States of America
He returned home in 1984
